meanings.definition: A horse that shares the same stable as another horse.
meanings.sent1: My horse's stablemate is a beautiful chestnut mare.
meanings.sent2: The two horses are stablemates and enjoy grazing together in the field.
meanings.sent3: When the stablemate horse tried to play hide-and-seek, it was quite a sight!
meanings.sent4: The bond between the stablemate horses was as strong as steel.
meanings.sent5: The stablemate horse nuzzled its companion affectionately.

meanings.definition: A person or thing that is closely associated or connected with another.
meanings.sent1: She considered her best friend to be her stablemate in all adventures.
meanings.sent2: The two companies were stablemates in the industry, often collaborating on projects.
meanings.sent3: The stablemate book on the shelf always seemed to fall open on the same page.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like that of stablemate ships sailing side by side.
meanings.sent5: The stablemate puzzle piece fit perfectly with its counterpart.
